titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Manufacturers' Association of New York annual banquet programs 1986.004
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:27 +0000.

did.unittitle: Manufacturers' Association of New York annual banquet programs
did.abstract: This collection contains two items from the Manufacturers' Association of New York: a program for the Association's 15th annual banquet held at the Union League Club in Brooklyn, dated 1908. The program includes a seating chart and a list of diners. Also included is a program for the 16th annual banquet held at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, 1909.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Xerxes Fine and Rare Books and Documents, 1986.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Manufacturers' Association of New York annual banquet programs, 1986.004, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
